Carter Dome from Carter Lake, New Hampshire

label: Description
value: A bright winter landscape at sunrise or sunset.  A lake inlet in center foreground with low rocks at lower right and windswept rocks, brush and trees in left foreground into middleground.  Looming over the lake, in right middleground, a large ball-shaped mountain with remnants of snow a crevice.  An orange, yellow, and blue sky fills the upper left quarter of the sheet.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, ink, gouache, graphite on wove paper

label: Provenance
value: William H. Matthews from the Estate of Frederick A. Moore; 1956: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of William H. Matthews from the Estate of Frederick A. Moore

label: Description
value: Dessert plate with straight, flat marly decorated with seven red and seven blue hexagonal cartouches with animals.  Between the cartouches green trees, above red stars and below, yellow trees and a red line with dents.

label: Description
value: Shaped edge with two bands of etched gold: between them, gold lattice with white and orange dots, and turquoise dots in spaces.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 3.2 x 25.4 cm (1 1/4 in. x 10 in.)

label: Description
value: Rectangular panel with a red ground, pattern reserved in white, with red overprinting. Hexagonal medallion framing a small landscape with peasant figures. Large flower clusters between medallions.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: relief printed, colored ground

label: Description
value: Rectangular panel with a red ground, pattern reserved in white, with red overprinting. Hexagonal medallion framing a small landscape with peasant figures. Large flower clusters between medallions.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: relief printed, colored ground

label: Description
value: Red ground with pattern in reserve white and red overprinting. Small octagonal medallion framing figure of a man in a large hat, cutaway coat, knee breeches, and pack on his back, approaching small houses, with a dog. Bouquets with garlands between medallions.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: relief and resist printed, colored ground

label: Description
value: Two lengths of sheer cotton seamed down longest edge. Spaced bands of lozenges and triangles inlaid with heavier cotton thread. Deep borders edged with openwork bands at either end. Twisted warp fringe.

label: Description
value: Horizontal bands of varying widths in heavy white cotton wefts alternating with bands of a much finer open weave with yellow silk wefts. Warp is fine white cotton threads. Three geometric bands embroidered at each end in white cotton with touches of red cotton, yellow silk, gray wool, grouped fine silk threads. Short twisted warp fringe at each end.

label: Description
value: Firm white cotton cloth with large irregular medallions in dark rust with touches of blue and green; metallic thread around border. Narrow embroidered edge in same colors. Tassels on four corners.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metallic thread on cotton Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Incomplete fragment of ribbed silk with a light beige ground brocaded in shades of caramel, beige, red, green and blue. Design shows pagoda, bridge, large palm in chinoiserie style. Both selvages present.

label: Description
value: Uncut pieces for costume accessories have a yellow and blue ground with dragons, clouds, rocks and waves in many shades of gray.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain and slit tapestry weave

label: Description
value: Uncut pieces for costume accessories have a yellow ground with a lobed blue ring containing a dragon, clouds and waves in many shades of gray.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain and slit tapestry weave

label: Description
value: Fragment of a Peruvian tapestry-woven mantle with a rich ochre ground and three wide bands with highly stylized animal motifs in shades of blue, green, tan, white, black, and red, set off by narrow red guard stripes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton warp, camelid fiber wefts Technique: plain weave with discontinuous weft (tapestry), single interlock Label: tapestry woven with cotton warp and camelid wefts

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund

label: Description
value: Rinceaux, grotesques and garlands set off a single figure medallion, above, and a horizontal panel below, showing figures classically dressed. Probably a decorative scheme for Robert Adam. Below, a scale, without numerical indication.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink with watercolor washes on paper

label: Description
value: Damask with a stylized floral border surrounding three horizontal rows containing Biblical scenes. The top row has three repeats of the Ascension along the text, "Jesus schwingt die Virges Sohn." The middle row depicts two men flanking a tree with the text, "Simon Petrus" written above. On the bottom row is a city scene with the word "Jerusalem" written above.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 182 x 69 cm (5 ft. 11 5/8 in. x 27 3/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of John Davis Hatch, Jr.

label: Description
value: Fragment of a blue and white floral damask with scalloped partial border.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1956: Mr. John Davis Hatch Jr. collection; 1956: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of John Davis Hatch, Jr.

label: Description
value: Small bird-on-bush repeat on a reddish-orange ground. Bird motif in blue, brown, white, green, and yellow. Yellow thread originally wrapped with silver, but now is mostly worn off.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Fragment of brocaded silk with white symmetrical floral and lace-like pattern on orange ground. Supplementary weft floats of yellow, green, blue and cream. Wide selvage, warp-corded and striped.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade), bound in twill

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1956: Edmund C. Pearson collection; 1956: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: A pair of Mechlin-style lace cap streamers with gently scalloped edges and a scrolling ascending vine with flowers and Rococo forms filled with small diaper patterns.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, Mechlin style

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 57.8 x 8 cm (22 3/4 x 3 1/8 in.) each

value: Medium: linen Technique: bobbin lace, Binche style with Binche ground

label: Description
value: At center, an oval reserve with a dedication to Aubin de Carnoy. Surrounding this, a singerie and strapwork design.

Plate 10, from Livre de bijouterie (Book of Designs for Goldsmiths and Jewelers)

label: Description
value: Design for six chains with strapwork and grotesques. Third chain from the right shows shellfish.

value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Design for two pendants with strapwork.  At left, a circular shape flanked by putti with gems and pearls. At right, a vertical oval with pairs of ignudi.

label: Description
value: Design for two pendants.  At left, two creatures with eagle heads below a basket of fruit. At right, strapwork with putti and masks.

value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Plate 13, from Livre de bijouterie (Book of Designs for Goldsmiths and Jewelers)

label: Description
value: Design for two brooches. At left, strapwork and trophies encircle a figural scene. Above, a mask. At right, a strapwork oval with harpies, masks and fruit encircles a central scene showing figures and a cow.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Plate 14, from Livre de bijouterie (Book of Designs for Goldsmiths and Jewelers)

label: Description
value: Design for two pendants. At left, a strapwork square flanked by masks and fruit. At center, an oval with classical figures. Above, a pearl hangs before a bearded mask. At right, two mermaids flank a central scene with figures standing under a tent, surrounding a smoking brazier. Above, two putti and a mask.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Plate 15, from Livre de bijouterie (Book of Designs for Goldsmiths and Jewelers)

label: Description
value: Design for two pendants. At left, strapwork with sphinxes and pearls. At top, a winged figure with a headdress rests each hand on a sphere. At right, pairs of ignudi and putti flanked a faceted central gem.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

value: Alternating rows of rings and chains, all with masks and strapwork.

label: Description
value: Designs for pendants with strapwork and masks. The right pendant shows harpies; the center pendant shows a reclining pair of putti; the left pendant shows a horned figure and has a tassel at bottom.

value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

value: Two pendant designs with strapwork. At left, an irregular pear-shaped pearl hangs from a lion’s mask. At right, a faceted gem and round pearl hang form a cherub.

label: Description
value: Design for a collar with alternative designs. At center, a faceted rectangular gem and a drop pearl. At top, winged figures; at bottom, swags of beads and festoons.

Plate 20, from Livre de bijouterie (Book of Designs for Goldsmiths and Jewelers)

label: Description
value: Design for a chain with pendant with alternative designs. At left, links are separated with masks; at right, they are separated with term figures. Circular pendant has a trefoil cartouche and is encircled with pearls.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Plate 3, from Livre de bijouterie (Book of Designs for Goldsmiths and Jewelers)

label: Description
value: Design for two pendants. At left, four square gems surround a central oval. Above, a pair of putti face inward; below, a pair of putti face outward, holding drop gems. At right, four oval gems surround a central square. Above, two putti. Below, three drop pearls, the center is pear-shaped.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Plate 4, from Livre de bijouterie (Book of Designs for Goldsmiths and Jewelers)

label: Description
value: Design for two pendants. At left, a merman and mermaid recline on two squares. Above, strapwork with masks and a central oval tablet with mythological scene. Below, a garland of beads and three drop pearls. At right, a pair of putti and pair of sphinxes flank a central gem. Below, horned masks, two drop pearls and a central tassel.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Design for two pendants with strapwork. At left, two nudes flank a faceted rectangle. Below, a mask and a drop pearl. At right, two ignudi flank a portrait medallion. Above, a mask. Below, a pear-shaped pear.
